meanings.definition: The act of shipping items or goods.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy watching the shiptimes of packages as they travel to different places.
meanings.sent2: The shiptimes for online orders can vary depending on the shipping method chosen.
meanings.sent3: The shiptimes for the toy delivery were so fast that it felt like magic!
meanings.sent4: Her excitement grew as the shiptimes of her new dress approached, like a countdown to a special event.
meanings.sent5: The shiptimes of the cargo ships were like synchronized dances on the ocean waves.

meanings.definition: The estimated time it takes for an item to be shipped.
meanings.sent1: The shiptimes for the new phone were longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: Customers appreciate accurate shiptimes provided by the shipping company.
meanings.sent3: The shiptimes for the birthday gift were delayed, causing some humorous confusion.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the shiptimes for deliveries became uncertain like a ship lost at sea.
meanings.sent5: The shiptimes for the holiday packages were like ticking clocks counting down to the festive season.

meanings.sent1: We need to shiptimes these products to our customers promptly.
meanings.sent2: The company will shiptimes the supplies to the warehouse next week.
meanings.sent3: She decided to shiptimes a surprise gift to her friend across the country.
meanings.sent4: The captain will shiptimes the cargo to the port with great care.
meanings.sent5: They plan to shiptimes the goods using the fastest shipping route available.
